chargeHist.descr: Child Abuse - Intentionally Cause Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Chuck A. Rupp-Kent was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Chuck A. Rupp-Kent is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Chuck A. Rupp-Kent was found guilty of Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: Credit for 14 days served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*  Pay restitution in the sum of $1,636.00 plus surcharges; joint & several w/14CF1335 and 14CF1392.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations.  May not have contact with Robert Sherrod, Steven Bialas, or Dwayne Wates II, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

supervisions.notes: PROBATION HAS BEEN REVOKED.  TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.

BOND PREVIOUSLY APPLIED - costs pd in full.
